MVAU Weight Top Generator File (gen_mvau_weight_mem_merged.py)

Author(s): Syed Asad Alam syed.as[xxx]ad.alam@tcd[xxx].ie

This file generates a top level weight memory file which instantiates all weight memories. The number of weight memories is equal to the number of PEs

This material is based upon work supported, in part, by Science Foundation Ireland, www.sfi.ie under Grant No. 13/RC/2094_P2 and, in part, by the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under the Marie Sklodowska-Curie grant agreement Grant No.754489.  #

Functions
gen_mvau_weight_mem_merged
def gen_mvau_weight_mem_merged(
pe
)

This function takes does the actual generation using a series of write commands. The use of Python generator was necessary so that the number of memories instantiated can be programmable and based on the number of PEs

Parameters
pe

Number of processing elements as the number of memories equals PE

Returns

None

parser
def parser()

This function defines an ArgumentParser object for command line arguments

Returns

Parser object (parser)

__main__
if __name__ == "__main__"

Entry point of the file, retrieves the command line arguments and calls the gen_mvau_weight_mem_merged function with the required arguments
